alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:31AM CDT until June 29 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PHILLIPS...FURNAS AND HARLAN COUNTIES... At 329 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Stamford, or 22 miles northeast of Norton, moving east at 45 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR Hendley, Beaver City, Stamford, Orleans, and Alma. HAZARD...Three inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. Up to three and half inch hail was reported in Wilsonville. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. This severe storm will be near... Orleans and Woodruff around 345 AM CDT. Alma around 350 AM CDT. Republican City and Harlan County Dam around 400 AM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...3.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
